question: Strenuous mental activity exhausts my resources, which I need to refuel afterwards (e.g., through taking breaks, doing nothing, watching television, eating snacks).
After a strenuous mental activity, my energy is depleted and I must rest to get it refuelled again.
When I have been working on a strenuous mental task, I feel energized and I am able to immediately start with another demanding activity.
My mental stamina fuels itself. Even after strenuous mental exertion, I can continue doing more of it.
When I have completed a strenuous mental activity, I cannot start another activity immediately with the same concentration because I have to recover my mental energy again.
After a strenuous mental activity, I feel energized for further challenging activities.
